conclusion: Analyze how liquid from A, B, and C would navigate through baffles to reach D or E.
Three liquid entry points at the top (A, B, and C), colored strips/baffles arranged diagonally, two collection containers at the bottom (D and E).
Liquid will encounter baffles as it flows downward.
Liquid starts flowing from point A (under the blue marker).
Liquid from A flows downward until it hits the black baffle.
Black baffle is angled from upper left to lower right.
Black baffle redirects liquid from A toward the right.
After being deflected, liquid from A continues downward.
Liquid from A encounters the turquoise/mint baffle.
Turquoise/mint baffle is angled from upper right to lower left.
Turquoise/mint baffle redirects liquid from A toward the left.
Liquid from A reaches the area above container D.
Liquid from point A would flow into container D.
Liquid starts flowing from point B (under the yellow marker).
Liquid from B moves downward and does not encounter the black baffle.
Liquid from B first hits the turquoise/mint baffle.
Turquoise/mint baffle redirects liquid from B toward the left.
Liquid from B continues downward and reaches the yellow baffle.
Yellow baffle is angled from upper left to lower right.
Yellow baffle redirects liquid from B back toward the right.
Liquid from B reaches container E.
Liquid from point B would flow into container E.
Liquid starts flowing from point C (under the pink marker).
Liquid from C moves downward and does not hit any baffles initially.
Liquid from C first encounters the yellow baffle.
